com.enjin.enjincoin.sdk

Interface Client

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable

    public interface Client
extends java.io.Closeable
    Client interface for communicating with the Trusted Platform. Provides access to the various service interfaces to perform common Trusted Platform requests.

    By default the notification service is lazy loaded and will only initialize upon calling getNotificationsService() the first time.

    A Client can be acquired by calling Clients.createClient(String, int, boolean).

    See Also:
    Clients, EthereumService, IdentitiesService, UsersService, RequestsService, TokensService, PlatformService, NotificationsService

    • Method Detail

      • auth

        HttpResponse<AuthResult> auth(java.lang.String secret)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the result of authenticating with the Trusted Platform using an App secret.

        The secret of an app can be retrieved by logging into a developer account and executing the following query: 

             query GetAppSecret($appId: Int!) {
         EnjinApps(id: $appId) {
             secret
         }
     }
        Parameters:
        secret - the app secret
        Returns:
        the result of the auth request
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurred while communicating with the server.
